commit_message:
Update iLO driver documentation for configuring Swift

This commit updates iLO driver documentation to reflect
that HTTPS has to enabled in Swift explicitly to encrypt
the communication with Swift for Ironic Conductor and
iLO.

Change-Id: I12d278f63474814f5c2b6df339004d700a697a1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/19/219619/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Users who have concerns on PXE driver's security issues and want to have a security enhanced PXE-less deployment mechanism. The PXE driver passes management info and boot images in clear-text to the baremetal node. However, if Swift proxy server has an HTTPS endpoint (See `Enabling HTTPS in Swift`_ for more information), the ``iscsi_ilo`` driver driver provides enhanced security by passing management info and boot images over encrypted management network. (Virtual Media) if Swift proxy server has an HTTPS endpoint. See `Enabling HTTPS in Swift`_ for more info. Provisioning is done using iSCSI over data network (like PXE driver), so this driver has the benefit of security enhancement with the same performance. Hence it segregates management info from data channel.Enabling HTTPS in Swift ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ iLO drivers ``iscsi_ilo`` and ``agent_ilo`` use Swift for storing boot images and management information. By default, HTTPS is not enabled in Swift. HTTPS is required to encrypt all communication between Swift and Ironic conductor and Swift and bare metal (via Virtual Media). It can be enabled in one of the following ways: * Using an SSL termination proxy. For more information, refer to http://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/content/tls-proxies-and-http-services.html * Using native SSL support in Swift (recommended only for testing purpose). + Create self-signed cert for SSL using the following commands:: cd /etc/swift openssl req -new -x509 -nodes -out cert.crt -keyout cert.key + Add the following lines to /etc/swift/proxy-server.conf under [DEFAULT]:: bind_port = 443 cert_file = /etc/swift/cert.crt key_file = /etc/swift/cert.key + Restart the Swift proxy server.
deleted_lines: * Current PXE driver passes authentication token in clear-text over tftp to the baremetal node. ``iscsi_ilo`` driver enhances the security by passing keystone authtoken and management info over encrypted management network. This driver may be used by users who have concerns on PXE drivers security issues and want to have a security enhanced PXE-less deployment mechanism. (Virtual Media). Provisioning is done using iSCSI over data network (like PXE driver), so this driver has the benefit of security enhancement with the same performance. Hence it segregates management info from data channel.

commit_message:
Source based builds should get novnc from tarball (git/url)

Source based centos, fedora and oraclelinux install novnc via
rdo repository while ubuntu and debian get novnc from github.
oraclelinux source build cannot use rdo, also using novnc tarballs
can be expanded to all distros.

Change-Id: I236dd5c36380e0592fceae4f4e1c28fe97dec1e7
Closes-Bug: #1490893

commit_message:
Map ubuntu versions to match the SHA256SUMs

Seems Ubuntu "trusty" have changed the SHA256SUMs file to contain the
numeric version instead of the codename. So this patch implements a map
between the codename and the numeric version for the current version of
Ubuntu, the old ones still using their codenames so we fallback to it.

Closes-Bug: #1490864
Change-Id: Ib72f3cdafe9fec68dcb84fac9d145a9fe871e1e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/99/219199/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Setup ubuntu build gate

Change-Id: I65c8ab12761c7e36923d4c5a0c3bbfc4b9adaf73
Partially-Implements: blueprint functional-testing-gate
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/43/219243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends docker-engine btrfs-tools sudo parted /dev/${DEV} -s -- mklabel msdos service docker stop echo 'DOCKER_OPTS="-s btrfs"' > /etc/default/docker rm -rf /var/lib/docker/* mkfs.btrfs -f /dev/${DEV} mount /dev/${dev} /var/lib/docker service docker start docker info

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-06 07:24:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/1af4c5bb942308c1228552143b31a972026492cc', 'message': 'Change the client according to volume migration improvement

This patch proposes the following changes:
* Add the --force flag to cinder migrate
The default value is False, which means the migration is able to
terminate if the owner of the volume issues command like attach
or detach during the volume migration.
If it is set to True, the migration of this volume will not be
terminated by other commands.

* List migration status for all the volumes
The attribute migration_status will be listed, if the request
is issued by an admin. Otherwise, the migration_status will not
be listed.

* Get the volume migration progress for one volume
This is an admin only action, make the admin possible to check
the migration progress in percentage.

DocImpact

Partially-implements-blueprint: migration-improvement
Change-Id: I5a1a717d1d08f550b45836d958a51f1f3fba5ced

Change Ia86421f2d6fce61dcfeb073f8e7b9c9dde517373 and Change
Ib156b6844cb82c0d8f70af8c6199c513644b82a0.

It proposes the following changes:
* Add the --force flag to cinder migrate
The default value is False, which means the migration is able to
terminate if the owner of the volume issues command like attach
or detach during the volume migration.
If it is set to True, the migration of this volume will not be
terminated by other commands.

* List migration status for all the volumes
The attribute migration_status will be listed, if the request
is issued by an admin. Otherwise, the migration_status will not
be listed.

* Get the volume migration progress for one volume
This is an admin only action, make the admin possible to check
the migration progress.

DocImpact

'}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2015-07-30 06:49:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/1e9af4677738e4a763fc908a4feff7df87baf922', 'message': 'Change cinderclient according to volume migration improvement

This patch proposes the following changes:
* Add the --lock-volume flag to cinder migrate
The default value is False, which means the migration is aborted
if the owner of the volume issues commands like attach
or detach during the volume migration.
If it is set to True, the migration of this volume will not be
aborted by other commands.

* List migration status for all the volumes
The attribute migration_status will be listed, if the request
is issued by an admin. Otherwise, the migration_status will not
be listed.

* Get the volume migration progress for one volume
This is an admin only action, make it possible for the admin
to check the migration progress.

DocImpact

This patch proposes the following changes
to the 'available' volume:
* Add the --lock-volume flag to cinder migrate
The default value is False, which means the migration is aborted
if the owner of the volume issues commands like attach
or detach during the volume migration. The volume will be in
'available' during migration.
If it is set to True, the migration of this volume will not be
aborted by other commands. The volume will be in 'maintenance'
during migration.

* List migration status for all the volumes
The attribute migration_status will be listed, if the request
is issued by an admin. Otherwise, the migration_status will not
be listed. The option migration_status is added for the admin
to filter the volumes returned via 'cinder list' command.

commit_message:
Volume status management for volume migration

This patch proposes the following changes
to the 'available' volume:
* Add the --lock-volume flag to cinder migrate
The default value is False, which means the migration is aborted
if the owner of the volume issues commands like attach
or detach during the volume migration. The volume will be in
'available' during migration.
If it is set to True, the migration of this volume will not be
aborted by other commands. The volume will be in 'maintenance'
during migration.

* List migration status for all the volumes
The attribute migration_status will be listed, if the request
is issued by an admin. Otherwise, the migration_status will not
be listed. The option migration_status is added for the admin
to filter the volumes returned via 'cinder list' command.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement
Change-Id: I5a1a717d1d08f550b45836d958a51f1f3fba5ced
Depends-On: Ia86421f2d6fce61dcfeb073f8e7b9c9dde517373

True means it allows the ' 'termination. False means it does not allow. ' 'Default=False.') volume.migrate_volume(args.host, args.force_host_copy, args.force)

commit_message:
Adds version info to ApplicationPackage

* adds version and runtime_version properties
* package/runtime version in package format string doesn't
  have to be fixed anymore. Now the version part is extracted,
  validated and will be available via runtime_version property
* package initialization code was moved to the package
   initializer removing the need for hot_v1/mpl_v1 scripts
* added requirement on semantic_version library

Partially implements: blueprint murano-versioning

Change-Id: I985846c2ad35be039e7025ff020ccbf22a870fb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/63/214163/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import stringimport semantic_versionimport murano.packages.hot_package import murano.packages.mpl_package 'MuranoPL': { ('1.0.0', '1.0.0'): murano.packages.mpl_package.MuranoPlPackage, }, 'Heat.HOT': { ('1.0.0', '1.0.0'): murano.packages.hot_package.HotPackage } p_format_spec = str(content.get('Format') or 'MuranoPL/1.0') if p_format_spec[0] in string.digits: p_format_spec = 'MuranoPL/' + p_format_spec parts = p_format_spec.split('/', 1) if parts[0] not in formats: format_set = formats[parts[0]] version = semantic_version.Version('0.0.0') if len(parts) > 1: version = semantic_version.Version.coerce(parts[1]) for key, value in format_set.iteritems(): min_version = semantic_version.Version(key[0]) max_version = semantic_version.Version(key[1]) if min_version <= version <= max_version: package = value(source_directory, content, loader, version) if preload: package.load() return package raise e.PackageFormatError( 'Unsupported {0} format version {1}'.format(parts[0], version))

commit_message:
Add rgw_op_thread_suicide_timeout parameter to ceph.conf

rgw_op_thread_suicide_timeout parameter was added to ceph.conf
to prevent glance hangups during connection to rados.

Closes-Bug:#1459743

Change-Id: Ib61b2f42077487a67e94c4413ac3c5491ad63cb7

commit_message:
Add filter to paramiko and iso8601 logs

Add filter to suppress debug logs from paramiko and iso8601 modules

Change-Id: I730ee4ede5e82ede0b44ec1f966d03c05c091804
Closes-bug: #1491007
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/93/219293/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # suppress iso8601 and paramiko debug logging class NoDebugMessageFilter(logging.Filter): def filter(self, record): return not record.levelno <= logging.DEBUG logging.getLogger('paramiko.transport').addFilter(NoDebugMessageFilter()) logging.getLogger('paramiko.hostkeys').addFilter(NoDebugMessageFilter()) logging.getLogger('iso8601.iso8601').addFilter(NoDebugMessageFilter())

commit_message:
Remove tethering between func and api tests and use venv for tempest

In this patch removed tethering between functional tests and api tests
which blocks test runs when tempest installation uses venv.
Also, in this patch implemented tempest venv using for main gate job,
which gave to main gate a beautiful stability against version conflicts.

Change-Id: I577399552341f4b8085637e5dab975ccdd28cd2b
Closes-Bug: #1476759
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/37/215137/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import zipfileclass TestCaseRepository(base.TestCase): @staticmethod def zip_dir(parent_dir, dir): abs_path = os.path.join(parent_dir, dir) path_len = len(abs_path) + 1 zip_file = abs_path + ".zip" with zipfile.ZipFile(zip_file, "w") as zf: for dir_name, _, files in os.walk(abs_path): for filename in files: fn = os.path.join(dir_name, filename) zf.write(fn, fn[path_len:]) return zip_file

commit_message:
Abandon environment on each exception during removal

In test-related function environment_delete, HTTPForbidden exception
didn't catched correctly if test fails by timeout.
This patch add catch for any exception during environment
delete.
Also, this patch add more logging to test functions for information
about test processes.

Change-Id: I6e35e00766b727c449345c83247b9e664a0b8061
Related-Bug: #1489916
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/99/219399/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Processing cleanup for environment {0} ({1})'. format(env.name, env.id)) @classmethod def purge_stacks(cls, environment_id): stack = cls._get_stack(environment_id) if not stack: return else: cls.heat_client().stacks.delete(stack.id) LOG.debug('Environment with id {0} successfully deleted.'. format(environment_id)) except RuntimeError or exceptions.HTTPForbidden: LOG.debug('Environment with id {0} going to be abandoned.'. format(environment_id))
deleted_lines: except RuntimeError: @classmethod def purge_stacks(cls, environment_id): stack = cls._get_stack(environment_id) if not stack: return else: cls.heat_client().stacks.delete(stack.id)

commit_message:
[WIP] Temporarily pin netaddr to use <0.7.16

This is a test to confirm whether it unblocks the
progression of https://review.openstack.org/218572

Change-Id: Ib71d72c394f219473b593ac10d644db650247ada
(cherry picked from commit 2220e3021c7162e18ded11d682feaba0522f09f2)

commit_message:
Add fields filter for workflow query

With this patch, users could retrieve workflows only with fields they care
about.

NOTE: 'id' must be included in fields if it's provided, since 'id' will be
used when constructing 'next' link.

This feature is just like we specicy '-c' argument in CLI, but it's
implemented in server side(or more precisely, in db layer).

Partially-Implements: blueprint query-result-column-filtering
Change-Id: If034e7ee96aaecf2d5cebefdc85eaa7b3f6f7d8c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/34/204634/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def convert_with_links(workflows, limit, url=None, fields=None, **kwargs): for f in workflows: f.unset_fields(fields) wf_collection.next = wf_collection.get_next( limit, url=url, fields=fields, **kwargs ) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Workflows, types.uuidtype, int, types.settype, types.listtype, types.settype) def get_all(self, marker=None, limit=None, sort_keys='created_at', sort_dirs='desc', fields=None): :param fields: a specified set of fields of the resource to be returned. Optional. "sort_dirs=%s, fields=%s", marker, limit, sort_keys, sort_dirs, fields) if fields: rest_utils.check_for_invalid_fields(fields, Workflow.get_fields()) sort_dirs=','.join(sort_dirs), fields=fields
deleted_lines: def convert_with_links(workflows, limit, url=None, **kwargs): wf_collection.next = wf_collection.get_next(limit, url=url, **kwargs) @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(Workflows, int, types.uuidtype, types.settype, types.listtype) def get_all(self, limit=None, marker=None, sort_keys='created_at', sort_dirs='desc'): "sort_dirs=%s", marker, limit, sort_keys, sort_dirs) sort_dirs=','.join(sort_dirs)

commit_message:
Configure rados_connect_timeout parameter in glance config

 This patch adds new config option for rados connect timeout,
which tells how much time glance-api  has to  wait before
close the connection.

Setting 'rados_connect_timeout' <= 0  means no timeout.

Upstream change-id: I2352bdec2a3339785eb38249afe385c5e496457c

Closes-Bug:#1459743

Change-Id: Ie4435a6bae56e8e6c1192ab66c83aa72a6b76305
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/49/218449/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*rados_connect_timeout*] # Optinal. Timeout value (in seconds) used when connecting # to ceph cluster. If value <= 0, no timeout is set and # default librados value is used. # $rados_connect_timeout = undef, 'glance_store/default_store': value => 'rbd'; 'glance_store/rbd_store_ceph_conf': value => $rbd_store_ceph_conf; 'glance_store/rbd_store_user': value => $rbd_store_user; 'glance_store/rbd_store_pool': value => $rbd_store_pool; 'glance_store/rbd_store_chunk_size': value => $rbd_store_chunk_size; 'glance_store/rados_connect_timeout': value => $rbd_store_chunk_size;

commit_message:
Drop QUnit JS tests in favor of Jasmine

Add `Instance`, `Tables`, `Templates`, `Messages`,
`Modals` Jasmine tests. Removed corresponding `Qunit`
javascript tests and dependencies on qunit library.

Partial-Bug: #1475387
Implements: blueprint replace-qunit-tests-with-jasmine
Change-Id: Ia415b65fb7b6299934c99e62a8c1f7225b93b03b

commit_message:
tests: use requests rather than httplib2

We do not use httplib2 anywhere except there. Requests seems to be
largely enough.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/50/219550/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The ``tools/build.py`` script in this repository is responsible for building docker images. Guide ----- $ tools/build.py By default, the above command would build all images based on centos image. If you want to change the base distro image, add ``-b``: $ tools/build.py -b ubuntu There are some available base distro image: - fedora - centos - oraclelinux - ubuntu - debian $ tools/build.py --push If you want to build keystone image only, just use the command like: $ tools/build.py keystone If you want to build both keystone and nova, just use the command like: $ tools/build.py keystone nova ``tools/build.py`` use ``kollaglue`` as default namespace. If you want to push images to your dockerhub, change the namespace like: $ tools/build.py -n yourusername --push
deleted_lines: The ``tools/build-docker-image`` script in this repository is responsible for building docker images. It is symlinked as ``./build`` inside each Docker image directory. When creating new image directories, you can run the ``tools/update-build-links`` scripts to install the ``build`` symlink (this script will install the symlink anywhere it find a file named ``Dockerfile``). Workflow -------- $ cd docker/keystone $ ./build By default, the above command would build ``kollaglue/centos-rdo-keystone:CID``, where ``CID`` is the current short commit ID. That is, given: $ git rev-parse HEAD 76a16029006a2f5d3b79f1198d81acb6653110e9 The above command would generate ``kollaglue/centos-rdo-keystone:76a1602``. This tagging is meant to prevent developers from stepping on each other or on release images during the development process. $ ./build --push To use these images, you must specify the tag in your ``docker run`` commands: $ docker run kollaglue/centos-rdo-keystone:76a1602 Building releases ----------------- To build into the ``latest`` tag, add ``--release``: $ ./build --release Or to build and push: $ ./build --push --release Build all images at once ------------------------ The ``build-all-docker-images`` script in the tools directory is a wrapper for the ``build-docker-image`` that builds all images, as the name suggests, in the correct order. It responds to the same options as ``build-docker-image`` with the additional ``--from`` and ``--to`` options that allows building only images that have changed between the specified git revisions. For example, to build all images contained in docker directory and push new release: :: $ tools/build-all-docker-images --release --push To build only images modified in test-branch along with their children: :: $ tools/build-all-docker-images --from master --to test-branch Configuration ------------- The ``build-docker-image`` script will look for a file named ``.buildconf`` in the image directory and in the top level of the repository. You can use this to set defaults, such as: :: NAMESPACE=larsks PREFIX=fedora-rdo- This setting would cause images to be tagged into the ``larsks/`` namespace and use Fedora as base image instead of the default CentOS.

commit_message:
Fix the selenium LazyLoadedTabsTests

These tests were broken when we removed Javascript loading
from the test base.html during the ngReorg. A minimal set
of Javascript and configuration has been re-added.

Also note that the loadAngular function from the tech-debt
utils service has been moved into the only place it's
used to reduce configuration overhead.

Partial-Bug: #1475387
Change-Id: If5472e93d7941608479b430512fc79c1fdb3407c

commit_message:
eventlet.posthook related code needn't anymore

In the past, older Swift seemed to use eventlet.posthooks scheme for the
logging on proxy with posthooklogger method. However, for now, Swift
attaches no method to eventlet.posthooks everywhere so we don't have
to maintain the posthooks anymore.

Change-Id: Ie63941a202d448532d980252a4d25575f8edab9c

subject: Make API services work multinode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-01 12:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/5f9787697dd2e78834fba269598e570cecb02fc2', 'message': "Make API services work multinode

A simple test case of running glance image-list in a loop fails on
a 3 node multinode cluster.  init-runonce totally implodes the system.
Authentication fails, possibly because a different keystone serves
up a second request after a first request is handled.  The second
keystone doesn't have the keystone token needed to do the job.  This
patch changes all the API services to follow the same path through
the network.  This is based upon the upstream HA guide here:

http://docs.openstack.org/high-availability-guide/content/ha-aa-haproxy.html

The change specifically does the following as specified in the
HA Proxy documentation:

    he source IP address is hashed and divided by the total
    weight of the running servers to designate which server will
    receive the request. This ensures that the same client IP
    address will always reach the same server as long as no
    server goes down or up.

Change-Id: Ie4317c4c18650f1047a51fa9b1d9338b9c5a73c9
Closes-Bug: #1490778
"}]
commit_message:
Make API services work multinode

A simple test case of running glance image-list in a loop fails on
a 3 node multinode cluster.  init-runonce totally implodes the system.
Authentication fails, possibly because a different keystone serves
up a second request after a first request is handled.  The second
keystone doesn't have the keystone token needed to do the job.  This
patch changes all the API services to follow the same path through
the network.  This is based upon the upstream HA guide here:

http://docs.openstack.org/high-availability-guide/content/ha-aa-haproxy.html

The change specifically does the following as specified in the
HA Proxy documentation:

    he source IP address is hashed and divided by the total
    weight of the running servers to designate which server will
    receive the request. This ensures that the same client IP
    address will always reach the same server as long as no
    server goes down or up.

Change-Id: Ie4317c4c18650f1047a51fa9b1d9338b9c5a73c9
Closes-Bug: #1490778

commit_message:
[spec] Refactoring Rally cleanup

Change-Id: Ie40373fda63ef79f64a211887021ce0e0e8d9d24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/67/172967/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================= Refactoring Rally Cleanup ========================= Current Rally cleans up all resources in tenants used by benchmark. This proposal should be useful for covering following use cases. Problem description =================== There are 3 use cases that requires cleanup refactoring: #. Benchmarking with existing tenants. Keep existing resources instead of deleting all resources in the tenants. #. Persistence benchmark environment. Once benchmark environment is created, it can be used in multiple tasks. #. Disaster cleanup. Delete all resources created by Rally even if we lose Rally DB. Proposed change =============== Resources created by Rally have same name prefix. At the cleanup, check the prefix and delete only matched resources. * Prefix `rally_` is for resources created by task. These are deleted after finishing the task. * Prefix `ctx_rally_` is for resources created by context. These are deleted when the environment is not necessary. Alternatives ------------ None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: wtakase aka Wataru Takase Work Items ---------- * Rework usage of generate_random_name() that should be called with specific prefix: `rally_` or `ctx_rally_`. * Add name prefix filter for deleting resource which has specified prefix. * Add ability to specify the filter to be used for handling more than one prefix. * Support negative filter which deletes unmatched resources. Dependencies ============ * Add name pattern filter for resource cleanup: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/139643/ * Finish support of benchmarking with existing users: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/168524/ * Add support of persistence benchmark environment: https://github.com/stackforge/rally/blob/master/doc/feature_request/persistence_benchmark_env.rst * Production read cleanups: https://github.com/stackforge/rally/blob/master/doc/feature_request/production_ready_cleanup.rst

commit_message:
Fix lbaas resources cleanup

Even if the extension is not available rally tries to list lbaas resources
to delete them. This results in a 404 exception.

This commit introduces NeutronLbaasV1Mixin that checks first if the
extension is available. If it's not it returns an empty list of
resources to delete.

All lbaas resources (only pools currently) must inherit from this mixin.

Change-Id: I94a8457c3026c1859413c867369cae49889f29e1
Closes-Bug: #1470330

added_lines: def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(NeutronMixin, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) self._extensions = self._manager().list_extensions().get("extensions", []) def supports_extension(self, extension): if any(ext.get("alias") == extension for ext in self._extensions): return True return Falseclass NeutronLbaasV1Mixin(NeutronMixin): def list(self): if not self.supports_extension("lbaas"): return [] return super(NeutronLbaasV1Mixin, self).list() class NeutronV1Pool(NeutronLbaasV1Mixin):

commit_message:
Enable --debug for debug logging

oslo_log wasn't getting the correct config values passed in, so adding
'--debug' to the command line wouldn't enable debug logging.

Added docs about --debug and --standalone (the only two flags I've
seen used/supported).

Change-Id: Ie1ba64992444a65a40f2d65933942153b93e70c1

commit_message:
Fixing occasional fail of test_create_action_execution

 * Fixed functional test 'test_create_action_execution'
 * Sometimes action execution is still not completed and
   response contains no output. Changed that mechanism to
   wait for completeness.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-20 18:45:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_server_actions.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_utils.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9c8e0591a46e5fc45395c919ca577f2664e016dd', 'message': 'Move is_volume_backed_instance to compute.utils

This function is a method of ComputeAPI, so its callers must have an
instance of the class. This make the usage difficult in modules wich do
not need to call ComputeAPI by other reason.

Besides this function does not use any of the class members. So there is
no reason for it to be the class method.

This patch moves this function to compute.utils because it does not use
anything of the class members.

Related-Bug: #1469179
Related-Bug: #1334974
Related-Bug: #1358566
Change-Id: Ic6bc4d2592d78270f835ac08654362b35b820234
'}]
commit_message:
Move is_volume_backed_instance to compute.utils

This function is a method of ComputeAPI, so its callers must have an
instance of the class. This make the usage difficult in modules wich do
not need to call ComputeAPI by other reason.

Besides this function does not use any of the class members. So there is
no reason for it to be the class method.

This patch moves this function to compute.utils because it does not use
anything of the class members.

Related-Bug: #1469179
Related-Bug: #1334974
Related-Bug: #1358566
Change-Id: Ic6bc4d2592d78270f835ac08654362b35b820234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/203766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_volume_backed_instance(context, instance, bdms=None): if not instance.image_ref: return True if bdms is None: bdms = objects.BlockDeviceMappingList.get_by_instance_uuid( context, instance.uuid) root_bdm = bdms.root_bdm() if not root_bdm: return False return root_bdm.is_volume

commit_message:
remove neutron advanced services from grenade

As the neutron splitout happens neutron advanced services should
actually be tested by grenade plugins instead. This decouples the
neutron advanced services from grenade so they can work on their own
upgrade mechanisms.

Change-Id: Iec8393660543e01f79a468142d9d7b5367c72af4

commit_message:
Add 'singleton' property to base policy

This patch adds 'singleton' attribute to base policy which is overridden
by the scaling policy implementation. The intent is to enable more than
one instances of scaling-policy to be attached to the same cluster.

Change-Id: I7a41fe0673bd076750ea57c2836f765805d0e2da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/08/218708/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.singleton = True

subject: fuel-bootstrap-image: create mandatory device nodes in the chroot
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-29 09:27:16.000000000', 'files': ['fuel-bootstrap-image-builder/bin/fuel-bootstrap-image'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/b71b0d7bda60661ae6d1f83f758c5e25eebe745d', 'message': 'fuel-bootstrap-image: create mandatory device nodes in the chroot

CentOS version of debootstrap creates a broken /dev: /dev/fd is a
directory rather than a symlink to /proc/self/fd. This breaks programs
which make use of /dev/fd/$N. One of such programs is bash. As a result
packages which use bash in their pre- or postinstallation scripts fail
to install into the bootstrap image being built.

To solve the problem make sure /dev/fd is a proper symlink. While at it
create the basic device nodes (/dev/null, /dev/zero, /dev/random, etc)
if they are missing.

Related-Bug: #1484077
Change-Id: I1e3975e20a8fa4afcac6c3201873f1dd0e54308b
'}]
commit_message:
fuel-bootstrap-image: create mandatory device nodes in the chroot

CentOS version of debootstrap creates a broken /dev: /dev/fd is a
directory rather than a symlink to /proc/self/fd. This breaks programs
which make use of /dev/fd/$N. One of such programs is bash. As a result
packages which use bash in their pre- or postinstallation scripts fail
to install into the bootstrap image being built.

To solve the problem make sure /dev/fd is a proper symlink. While at it
create the basic device nodes (/dev/null, /dev/zero, /dev/random, etc)
if they are missing.

Related-Bug: #1484077
Change-Id: I1e3975e20a8fa4afcac6c3201873f1dd0e54308b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/59/218559/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # XXX: CentOS version of debootstrap produces a broken /dev: # /dev/fd is a directory instead of a symlink to /proc/self/fd dev_fixup () { local root="$1" if [ -z "$root" ]; then echo "*** Error: $MYSELF: dev_fixup: \$root is not specified" >&2 exit 1 fi mkdir -p -m755 "$root/dev" if [ ! -L "$root/dev/fd" ]; then rm -rf "$root/dev/fd" # Ask MAKEDEV to re-create /dev/fd, /dev/stdin, etc chroot "$root" /bin/sh -c "cd /dev && MAKEDEV fd" fi if [ ! -c "$root/dev/null" ]; then # basic device nodes are missing => create them chroot "$root" /bin/sh -c "cd /dev && MAKEDEV std" fi } dev_fixup "$root"

Angularize metadata update modals

Update table action to use new angular modal dialog.
Remove "Metadata Update" views.

Implemenents: blueprint angularize-metadata-update-modals

subject: Simplify ACK/Offer for DHCP app
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-01 06:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/dhcp_app.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow/commit/70d1d3d6bb289c2d9a0552ecbf814fac4f19f606', 'message': 'Simplify ACK/Offer for DHCP app

Instead of retrieving subnet object for each parameter, retrieve it
one time and pass the subnet object to all getter methods.
The getter methods dont really have any validations on the fields

Change-Id: Iee97d0869209d090e4944e0c70d459b3dc797e07
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify ACK/Offer for DHCP app

Instead of retrieving subnet object for each parameter, retrieve it
one time and pass the subnet object to all getter methods.
The getter methods dont really have any validations on the fields
just on the subnet object, so its ok.

Change-Id: Iee97d0869209d090e4944e0c70d459b3dc797e07
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/45/219145/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if subnet is None: LOG.error(_LE("No subnet found for port <%s>") % lport.get_id()) return dns = self._get_dns_address_list_bin(subnet) dhcp_server_address = str(self._get_dhcp_server_address(subnet)) gateway_address = self._get_port_gateway_address(subnet) netmask_bin = self._get_port_netmask(subnet).packed if subnet is None: LOG.error(_LE("No subnet found for port <%s>") % lport.get_id()) dns = self._get_dns_address_list_bin(subnet) dhcp_server_address = self._get_dhcp_server_address(subnet) netmask_bin = self._get_port_netmask(subnet).packed gateway_address = self._get_port_gateway_address(subnet) if len(subnet.get_dns_name_servers()) > 0: dns_servers = subnet.get_dns_name_servers() def _get_dhcp_server_address(self, subnet): return netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.get_dhcp_server_address()) def _get_port_gateway_address(self, subnet): return netaddr.IPAddress(subnet.get_gateway_ip()) def _get_port_netmask(self, subnet): return netaddr.IPNetwork(subnet.get_cidr()).netmask

commit_message:
Add DHCP/DNS configuration to DHCP APP

This retrieve DNS and DHCP configuration from config files
and gets dns name servers configuration from subnet object
if they were configured.

Change-Id: I22fb8c500059ca7a9f67169fc095840adb0cca86

commit_message:
Support subnet updates and add dns_servers configuration to subnet

Add support for subnet updates from the plugin.
Add support for subnet update in NB DB.
Add dns_servers configuration per subnet.

Change-Id: Iafc9df85895c4e716922c084e5bdea71a264887e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/31/219131/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_subnet(self, id, lswitch_name, **columns): lswitch_json = self.driver.get_key('lswitch', lswitch_name) lswitch = jsonutils.loads(lswitch_json) subnet = None for s in lswitch.get('subnets', []): if s['id'] == id: subnet = s for col, val in columns.items(): subnet[col] = val lswitch_json = jsonutils.dumps(lswitch) self.driver.set_key('lswitch', lswitch_name, lswitch_json)

subject: WIP: Generic ini conf template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 15:47:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/48832c7fee9cfdbd02493f18a4fa88e757896e74', 'message': 'WIP: Generic ini conf template

Currently ini-style conf files require explicit templates. This has a
number of downsides in terms of maintenance and configurability.

This commit adds a role to the project for generating a conf file based
on a generic template.

The template requires the ansible variables be named using a specific
format:

prefix_confsection_confvariable: confvariablevalue

For example:

  nova_conf_DEFAULT_verbose: true

_ is the default separator, it is used to split the ansible variable
into the parts for use in the template.

Ansible variables are only allowed to contain [a-zA-Z0-9_]. In most
cases that is sufficient however there a conf files where section names
contain other characters e.g. ':' or '-'. This means there needs to be a
way to allow them to be inserted when required. The role will allow
mappings to be specified for the purpose.

An example of how an option in the swift.conf file would be handled:

  swift_conf_swift__hyphen__hash_swift_hash_path_prefix = "changeme"

The prefix is swift_conf, swift__hyphen__hash is the section in the conf
file, swift_hash_path_prefix is the option name and "chanageme" is the
value.

The config Ansible vars must be found in hostvars[inventory_hostname]
but they may reference vars not found in there.

Implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration
Change-Id: I08e9c4b0e02744fb445691d5a3c2acfd2e83dfc4

commit_message:
WIP: Generic ini conf template

Currently ini-style conf files require explicit templates. This has a
number of downsides in terms of maintenance and configurability.

This commit adds a role to the project for generating a conf file based
on a generic template.

The template requires the ansible variables be named using a specific
format:

prefix__confsection__confvariable: confvariablevalue

For example:

  nova_conf__DEFAULT__verbose: true

__ is the default separator, it is used to split the ansible variable
into the parts for use in the template.

Ansible variables are only allowed to contain [a-zA-Z0-9_]. In most
cases that is sufficient however there a conf files where section names
contain other characters e.g. ':' or '-'. This means there needs to be a
way to allow them to be inserted when required. The role will allow
mappings to be specified for the purpose.

An example of how an option in the swift.conf file would be handled:

  swift_conf__swift__hyphen__hash__swift_hash_path_prefix = "changeme"

The prefix is swift_conf, swift__hyphen__hash is the section in the conf
file, swift_hash_path_prefix is the option name and "chanageme" is the
value.

The config Ansible vars must be found in hostvars[inventory_hostname]
but they may reference vars not found in there.

Implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration
Change-Id: I08e9c4b0e02744fb445691d5a3c2acfd2e83dfc4

commit_message:
WIP: Separate nova.conf vars from os_nova role

This commit uses the ini-conf role to break out nova.conf-specific data
from the os_nova role.

commit_message:
Add RPC APIs for RAID configuration

This commit introduces two new RPC APIs -
set_target_raid_config and get_raid_logical_disk_properties
for doing RAID configuration.

Change-Id: Iaf5aefd61367f4b3281e9bb1bfc996068489348a
Implements: blueprint ironic-generic-raid-interface
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/06/196006/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: | 1.30 - Added put_raid_configuration and | get_raid_logical_disk_properties RPC_API_VERSION = '1.30' def put_raid_configuration(self, context, node_id, target_raid_config, topic=None): """Puts the RAID configuration of the node. Puts the target RAID configuration for the given node. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :param target_raid_config: RAID configuration information. :raises: UnsupportedDriverExtension if the node's driver doesn't support RAID configuration. """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic or self.topic, version='1.30') return cctxt.call(context, 'put_raid_configuration', node_id=node_id, target_raid_config=target_raid_config) def get_raid_logical_disk_properties(self, context, driver_name, topic=None): """Get the RAID physical disks for the node. Gets the information about physical disks available in the node for RAID configuration. :param context: request context. :param node_id: node id or uuid. :raises: UnsupportedDriverExtension if the node's driver doesn't support RAID configuration. :returns: A dictionary containing the properties that can be mentioned for logical disks and a textual description for them. """ cctxt = self.client.prepare(topic=topic or self.topic, version='1.30') return cctxt.call(context, 'get_raid_logical_disk_properties', driver_name=driver_name)

commit_message:
Fix failure of run_action CLI command

* Dump the 'param' argument before creating action-execution.
* Add functional tests for action-execution's creation and deletion.

Closes-Bug: #1490894
Change-Id: I93346ba54cc7b6d8cc2cb1e62d93c8a70a02d0dd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/23/219223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_act_execution_create_delete(self): action_ex = self.mistral_admin( 'run-action', params="std.echo '{0}' --save-result".format( '{"output": "Hello!"}') ) action_ex_id = self.get_value_of_field(action_ex, 'ID') self.assertTableStruct(action_ex, ['Field', 'Value']) name = self.get_value_of_field(action_ex, 'Name') wf_name = self.get_value_of_field(action_ex, 'Workflow name') task_name = self.get_value_of_field(action_ex, 'Task name') self.assertEqual('std.echo', name) self.assertEqual('None', wf_name) self.assertEqual('None', task_name) action_exs = self.mistral_admin('action-execution-list') self.assertIn(action_ex_id, [ex['ID'] for ex in action_exs]) self.mistral_admin('action-execution-delete', params=action_ex_id) action_exs = self.mistral_admin('action-execution-list') self.assertNotIn(action_ex_id, [ex['ID'] for ex in action_exs])

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: If724fbfc0b7e04f4b79e42aa6b9f00b54210a506

commit_message:
n-net: add more debug logging to release_fixed_ip

Despite commit 8c7690221294d6d7f2db84491fec8d81ef358cac we're still
seeing this race in the gate so add more debug logging in the
release_fixed_ip method to get a better idea of what's going on.

Related-Bug: #1249065

Change-Id: I9eda6cadf8aa31576bedf10c71c41fe1a3d4d629
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/08/197608/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOG.debug('Checking to see if virtual interface with MAC ' '%(mac)s is still associated to instance: ' '%(instance)s', {'mac': mac, 'instance': fixed_ip.instance_uuid}) if vif: LOG.debug('Found VIF: %s', vif) if vif.instance_uuid != fixed_ip.instance_uuid: LOG.info(_LI("Ignoring request to release fixed IP " "%(address)s with MAC %(mac)s since it " "is now associated with a new instance " "that is in the process of allocating " "it's network."), {'address': address, 'mac': mac}, instance_uuid=fixed_ip.instance_uuid) return else: LOG.debug('No VIF was found for MAC: %s', mac) LOG.debug('Disassociating fixed IP %s from instance.', address, instance_uuid=fixed_ip.instance_uuid)
deleted_lines: if vif and vif.instance_uuid != fixed_ip.instance_uuid: LOG.info(_LI("Ignoring request to release fixed IP " "%(address)s with MAC %(mac)s since it is " "now associated with a new instance that is " "in the process of allocating it's network."), {'address': address, 'mac': mac}, instance_uuid=fixed_ip.instance_uuid) return

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-27 04:21:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/8e1209b20e578876a2115b87b18f41564afabb60', 'message': 'Add support for creating subnets with Neutron subnet allocation

The user is enabled to choose between entering a network address
manually or to allocate a network address from a pool. The pool can
either be created by the user himself or by the provider. With the
advent of address scopes in Neutron this feature will be used for
enabling routing of globally unique addresses (GUA) all the way in
to the VM. This is a prerequisite for IPv6 to be routable, and will
also at some point allow GUA-IPv4 without NAT.

If the user choose to enter network address manually the form will
behave like before. If the user chose to allocate a network address
from a pool she will be presented with two new drop-down menus. The
first drop-down menu will present the names of the pools and also
list what prefixes they have. The next drop-down menu will display
the available prefix lengths that is available for allocation. The
default prefix length defined by the pool will be selected.

The "Create Subnet" checkbox has been moved to first step of the
workflow. This is because of how switchable fields work, and how you
can not safely define more than one slug in a fields "switch-on"
attribute. For the sake of User Experience, we need to reliably
switch fields based on selected Address source on the Subnet tab.
IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the first
step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now click directly on "Create"!

Dependency on python-neutronclient 2.4.0 or newer handled gracefully.
I have also proposed a update to global requirements that reflect
this new dependency.

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-allocation
'}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-27 15:00:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/961ca270a7e1cc021e9215e5c77afbe87a1167d3', 'message': 'Add support for creating subnets with Neutron subnet allocation

The user is enabled to choose between entering a network address
manually or to allocate a network address from a pool. The pool can
either be created by the user or the provider. With the advent of
address scopes in Neutron this feature will be used for enabling
routing of globally unique addresses (GUA) all the way in to the VM.
This is a prerequisite for IPv6 to be routable, and will also at
some point allow GUA-IPv4 without NAT.

If the user chooses to enter network address manually the form will
behave like before. If the user chooses to allocate a network address
from a pool she will be presented with two new drop-down menus. The
first drop-down menu will present the names and prefixes of available
pools. The next drop-down menu will display available choices for
prefix lengths. The available choices are defined by the subnet pool.
Default prefix length defined by the pool will be selected. The user
is also presented with an option to request a specific network address.
The correct IP version is selected based on what IP version is defined
by the selected subnet pool.

The "Create Subnet" checkbox has been moved from the Subnet step to
the first step of the workflow. This is because of how switchable
fields work, and how you can not safely define more than one slug in a
fields "switch-on" attribute. For the sake of User Experience, we need
to reliably switch fields based on selected Address source on the
Subnet tab. IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the
first step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now uncheck the "Create Subnet" checkbox and click directly on "Create".

Dependency on python-neutronclient 2.4.0 or newer handled gracefully.

I have also proposed a update to global requirements that reflect
this new dependency.

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-allocation
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2015-07-30 13:19:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/1175848edeeb38541214d4abbacf816a1d76f035', 'message': 'Add support for creating subnets with Neutron subnet allocation

The user is enabled to choose between entering a network address
manually or to allocate a network address from a pool. The pool can
either be created by the user or the provider. With the advent of
address scopes in Neutron this feature will be used for enabling
routing of globally unique addresses (GUA) all the way in to the VM.
This is a prerequisite for IPv6 to be routable, and will also at
some point allow GUA-IPv4 without NAT.

Workflow:
If the user chooses to enter network address manually the form will
behave like before.

If the user chooses to allocate a network address from a pool she
will be presented with two new drop-down menus. The first drop-down
menu will, in addition to a "Default" choice, present the names and
prefixes of available pools. The next drop-down menu will display
available choices for prefix lengths (it will show "Default" if the
"Default" pool is selected). The available choices are defined by the
subnet pool. Default prefix length defined by the pool will be selected.
The user is also presented with an option to request a specific network
address. The correct IP version is selected based on what IP version
is defined by the selected subnet pool.

The "Create Subnet" checkbox has been moved from the Subnet step to
the first step of the workflow. This is because of how switchable
fields work, and how you can not safely define more than one slug in a
fields "switch-on" attribute. For the sake of User Experience, we need
to reliably switch fields based on selected Address source on the
Subnet tab. IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the
first step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now uncheck the "Create Subnet" checkbox and click directly on "Create".

Dependencies:
Dependency on python-neutronclient 2.4.0 or newer handled gracefully.

I have also proposed a update to global requirements that reflect
this new dependency.

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-allocation
'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-23 22:28:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/0891d7162a67fa023ac6132a0cfd03e570b0be41', 'message': 'Add support for creating subnets with Neutron subnet allocation

Subnet tab. IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the
first step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now uncheck the "Create Subnet" checkbox and click directly on "Create".

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-allocation

'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2015-08-27 13:34:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6a1986e5b73a26072659a4904dc9371ee4ec8a94', 'message': 'Add support for creating subnets with Neutron subnet allocation

The user is enabled to choose between entering a network address
manually or to allocate a network address from a pool. With the
advent of address scopes in Neutron this feature will be used for
enabling routing of globally unique addresses (GUA) all the way in
to the VM. This is a prerequisite for IPv6 to be routable, and will
also at some point allow GUA-IPv4 without NAT.

Workflow:
If subnet allocation is not supported in back end, there are no
subnet pools available or the user chooses to enter network address
manually the form will behave like before.

If subnet allocation is supported in back end and there either are
subnet pools available or the label for the default subnet pool(s) is
configured, the user may choose to allocate a network address from a
pool. The user will then be presented with two new drop-down menus.
The first drop-down menu will, in addition to the default pool (if
configured), present the names and prefixes of available pools. The
next drop-down menu will display available choices for prefix lengths
(it will not be displayed if the "default pool" is selected). The
available choices are defined by the subnet pool. Default prefix length
defined by the pool will be selected. The user is also presented with an
option to request a specific network address. The correct IP version
is selected based on what IP version is defined by the selected subnet
pool.

The "Create Subnet" checkbox has been moved from the Subnet step to
the first step of the workflow. This is because of how switchable
fields work, and how you can not safely define more than one slug in a
fields "switch-on" attribute. For the sake of User Experience, we need
to reliably switch fields based on selected Address source on the
Subnet tab. IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the
first step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now uncheck the "Create Subnet" checkbox and click directly on "Create".

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-allocation

The "Create Subnet" checkbox has been moved from the Subnet step to
the first step of the workflow. This is because of how switchable
fields work, and how you can not safely define more than one slug in a
fields "switch-on" attribute. For the sake of User Experience, we need
to reliably switch fields based on selected Address source on the
Subnet tab. IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the
first step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now uncheck the "Create Subnet" checkbox and click directly on "Create".

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b

commit_message:
Support create subnet w/Neutron subnet allocation

The user is enabled to choose between entering a network address
manually or to allocate a network address from a pool. With the
advent of address scopes in Neutron this feature will be used for
enabling routing of globally unique addresses (GUA) all the way in
to the VM. This is a prerequisite for IPv6 to be routable, and will
also at some point allow GUA-IPv4 without NAT.

Workflow:
If subnet allocation is not supported in backend, there are no
subnet pools available, or the user chooses to enter network address
manually the form will behave like before.

If subnet allocation is supported in backend and there either are
subnet pools available or the label for the default subnet pool(s) is
configured, the user may choose to allocate a network address from a
pool. The user will be presented with two new drop-down menus. The
first drop-down menu will, in addition to the default pool (if
configured), present the names and prefixes of available pools. The
next drop-down menu will display available choices for prefix lengths
(it will not be displayed if the "default pool" is selected). The
available choices are defined by the subnet pool. Default prefix length
defined by the pool will be selected. The correct IP version is used
based on what IP version is defined by the selected subnet pool.

The "Create Subnet" checkbox has been moved from the Subnet step to
the first step of the workflow. This is because of how switchable
fields work, and how you can not safely define more than one slug in a
fields "switch-on" attribute. For the sake of User Experience, we need
to reliably switch fields based on selected Address source on the
Subnet tab. IMHO it also makes more sense to have this checkbox on the
first step of the workflow, if you just want to create a network you can
now uncheck the "Create Subnet" checkbox and click directly on "Create".

Change-Id: Ie392ccd9feae4dc02c3f30e2475457e755700b6b
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-allocation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/70/203570/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'enable_subnetpools': True,

commit_message:
Don't query database with an empty list of tags for creation

It raises IntegrityError: NOT NULL constraint failed: tags.resource_id

Closes-Bug: #1486041

Change-Id: I9fe43e50ef38bda7b81d0ff201a623742a39b824

deleted_lines: data = [{'resource_id': instance_uuid, 'tag': tag} for tag in to_add] session.execute(models.Tag.__table__.insert(), data)

commit_message:
Support action_execution deletion on client side

$ mistral action-execution-delete <action_execution_id>

NOTE:
* By default, users can't perform such operation, unless the
  'allow_action_execution_deletion' is set to True on server side.
* Only ad-hoc action-execution can be deleted.

Change-Id: Iad0bfb0c2f688928d1e1bd8c41fcf90acd94cd66
Implements: blueprint mistralclient-action-execution-deletion
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/84/219184/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete(self, id): self._ensure_not_empty(id=id) self._delete('/action_executions/%s' % id)

commit_message:
check all possible services when configuring tempest

The previous approach assumed that devstack in tree service support
would always be a super set of tempest. That's not necessarily
true. Instead when configuring tempest we should look at all the
possible services that tempest could know about, which will let us
disable services we don't have support for.

Change-Id: I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/36/217136/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove fall-back logic to service provider registration

Once [1] merges, we no longer need to catch the AttributeError
exception, so clean this up.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202207

Change-Id: I59eaf1dfd67751fdb4026407ea29e9f39fcbc2f9
Related-bug: #1473110

deleted_lines: try: type_manager.add_provider_configuration( service_type, pconf.ProviderConfiguration('neutron_vpnaas')) except AttributeError: # TODO(armax): remove this try catch once the API # add_provider_configuration becomes available LOG.debug('add_provider_configuration API is not available')

subject: EC GET path: require fragments to be of same set
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 20:51:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/35a1f7809951a3b002074c27ef6cdd8c2e6a3764', 'message': "EC GET path: require fragments to be of same set

and if they are node, exhaust the node iter to go get more.  The
problem without this implementation is a simple overwrite where
a GET follows before the handoff has put the newer obj back on
the 'alive again' node such that the proxy gets n-1 fragments
of the newest set and 1 of the older.

this patch bucketizes the fragments by etag and if it doesn't
have enough continues to exhaust the node iterator (parity
next) until it has a large enough matching set.

Change-Id: Ib710a133ce1be278365067fd0d6610d80f1f7372
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1457691
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-12 22:40:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/ac11caac119c5591861a6e1afcc5d51c73cb7c76', 'message': "EC GET path: require fragments to be of same set

and if they are node, exhaust the node iter to go get more.  The
problem without this implementation is a simple overwrite where
a GET follows before the handoff has put the newer obj back on
the 'alive again' node such that the proxy gets n-1 fragments
of the newest set and 1 of the older.

this patch bucketizes the fragments by etag and if it doesn't
have enough continues to exhaust the node iterator (parity
next) until it has a large enough matching set.

Change-Id: Ib710a133ce1be278365067fd0d6610d80f1f7372
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1457691

commit_message:
EC GET path: require fragments to be of same set

And if they are not, exhaust the node iter to go get more.  The
problem without this implementation is a simple overwrite where
a GET follows before the handoff has put the newer obj back on
the 'alive again' node such that the proxy gets n-1 fragments
of the newest set and 1 of the older.

This patch bucketizes the fragments by etag and if it doesn't
have enough continues to exhaust the node iterator until it
has a large enough matching set.

Change-Id: Ib710a133ce1be278365067fd0d6610d80f1f7372
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: 1457691

added_lines: import random from hashlib import md5from test.probe.common import (kill_server, start_server, ReplProbeTest, ECProbeTest, Body)class TestECObjectHandoffOverwrite(ECProbeTest): def get_object(self, container_name, object_name): headers, body = client.get_object(self.url, self.token, container_name, object_name, resp_chunk_size=64 * 2 ** 10) resp_checksum = md5() for chunk in body: resp_checksum.update(chunk) return resp_checksum.hexdigest() def test_ec_handoff_overwrite(self): container_name = 'container-%s' % uuid4() object_name = 'object-%s' % uuid4() # create EC container headers = {'X-Storage-Policy': self.policy.name} client.put_container(self.url, self.token, container_name, headers=headers) # PUT object old_contents = Body() client.put_object(self.url, self.token, container_name, object_name, contents=old_contents) # get our node lists opart, onodes = self.object_ring.get_nodes( self.account, container_name, object_name) # shutdown one of the primary data nodes failed_primary = random.choice(onodes[:self.policy.ec_ndata]) failed_primary_device_path = self.device_dir('object', failed_primary) self.kill_drive(failed_primary_device_path) # overwrite our object with some new data new_contents = Body() client.put_object(self.url, self.token, container_name, object_name, contents=new_contents) # restore failed primary device self.revive_drive(failed_primary_device_path) # sanity - failed node has old contents req_headers = {'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index': int(self.policy)} headers = direct_client.direct_head_object( failed_primary, opart, self.account, container_name, object_name, headers=req_headers) self.assertEqual(headers['X-Object-Sysmeta-EC-Etag'], old_contents.etag) # clear node error limiting Manager(['proxy']).restart() # read object for i in range(10): # do it a few times to make sure node shuffle doesn't # accidently work around the issue for us resp_etag = self.get_object(container_name, object_name) self.assertEqual(resp_etag, new_contents.etag)

commit_message:
Replace urllib with six.moves.urllib for py3 support

This patch does the following for py3 support:
1. replace httplib with six.moves.http_client
2. replace func.func_name with func.__name__
3. replace urllib with six.moves.urllib

Change-Id: Ic18934b47da7844506482b29a3ecb2a36b3ce33f
Partially-Implements: blueprint barbican-py3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/70/206770/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves.urllib import parse plugin_name = parse.unquote_plus(plugin_name) plugin_ca_id = parse.unquote_plus(plugin_ca_id)
deleted_lines: import urllib plugin_name = urllib.unquote_plus(plugin_name) plugin_ca_id = urllib.unquote_plus(plugin_ca_id)

commit_message:
Add custom fragment to vhost

Add possibility to pass custom_fragment to apache::vhost
in order to provide lines, that are not supported by module.
(for example LimitRequestFieldSize for keystone)

Change-Id: Ibfa120d3bd3051f0e619bd6d245ae2cd4e12cbaf
Closes-Bug: 1475767

commit_message:
Event filtering for non-admin users

Non-admin users should be restricted to see only those
events that were generated by them and not the events
associated with other users.The current behavior doesn't
have any restrictions on the events that a non-admin user
can view.As part of this patch, a non-admin user will see
only the events that are associated with the user_id and
project_id that the user requesting events belongs to.
Events stored in the ceilometer database has information
from all other services and in a cloud environment, there
must be restrictions on the data a non-admin user can access.

Change-Id: I2ed7425c14a70d1db4621a277ba5f4f575a15eba
blueprint: events-rbac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/44/217844/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Returns usr_id, proj_id for non-admins usr_id, proj_id = rbac.get_limited_to(pecan.request.headers) # If non-admin, filter events by user and project if (usr_id and proj_id): traits_filter.append({"key": "project_id", "string": proj_id, "op": "eq"}) traits_filter.append({"key": "user_id", "string": usr_id, "op": "eq"})

commit_message:
Remove Nova v21 neutron job & make one for v2.0

devstack patch - I99cfe237291fcb727a32a3ec1d01efe44a7ce3b0
makes Nova v21 API as default for gate jobs.

As all existing nova gate jobs will run against v2.1 API, job
'tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-neutron-full' is more needed.
Also we need job to run tests against v2 API.

This patch remove 'tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-neutron-full' job.
Also rename 'tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-full' job to 'tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-full'
and make it to run against v2 API.

Also making *tempest-dsvm-full* job to run against v2.1 till v2.1 is default
in Devstack.

Change-Id: I3b4096ed12cd85a977bd732f915c439d257345ab

added_lines: name: '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-full{branch-designator}' export DEVSTACK_GATE_NOVA_TEST_AGAINST_V2_API=1 - '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-full{branch-designator}'
deleted_lines: name: '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-full{branch-designator}' export DEVSTACK_GATE_NOVA_REPLACE_V2_ENDPOINT_WITH_V21_API=1 name: '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-neutron-full{branch-designator}' node: '{node}' wrappers: - build-timeout: timeout: 125 - timestamps builders: - link-logs - net-info - devstack-checkout - shell: | #!/bin/bash -xe export PYTHONUNBUFFERED=true export DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT=120 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_FULL=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_NOVA_REPLACE_V2_ENDPOINT_WITH_V21_API=1 export BRANCH_OVERRIDE={branch-override} if [ "$BRANCH_OVERRIDE" != "default" ] ; then export OVERRIDE_ZUUL_BRANCH=$BRANCH_OVERRIDE fi cp devstack-gate/devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh ./safe-devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh publishers: - devstack-logs - console-log - job-template: - '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-full{branch-designator}' - '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-neutron-full{branch-designator}'

commit_message:
Make Nova v2.1 API default for testing

Nova v2.1 API is CURRENT API now, and Nova v2 API is SUPPORTED API.
So the gate should test Nova v2.1 API by default instead of Nova v2 API.

This commit makes Nova v2.1 API as default API by changing the "catalog_type"
value to "computev21".

Nova v2 API is still SUPPORTED API, so the gate needs to test it also.
For that nova v2 jobs can set catalog_type to "compute".
(Current job "tempest-dsvm-nova-v21-full" is going to be changed to
"tempest-dsvm-nova-v20-full" for v2 API testing.
- I3b4096ed12cd85a977bd732f915c439d257345ab)

Depends-On: I3b4096ed12cd85a977bd732f915c439d257345ab

Change-Id: I99cfe237291fcb727a32a3ec1d01efe44a7ce3b0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/18/163718/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # - v2default - setup API end points as nova does out of the boxNOVA_API_VERSION=${NOVA_API_VERSION-v21default}
deleted_lines: # - default - setup API end points as nova does out of the boxNOVA_API_VERSION=${NOVA_API_VERSION-default}

commit_message:
api: use v2.1 only in api-paste.ini

I have taken a look at:
* removed /v3
* /v2 and /v1.1 now uses v2.1 legacy mode
* add deprecation warnings for old v2 code and ec2
* ensure legacy v2 code is not used by default

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Depends-On: I513b54eeacee1486ea11b85913ab2d21727fc5f9
dropping a tempest test that assumes certain validation order

Change-Id: I94b1305882598cc259a267dc8e954ab242baf7d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/214085/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: this is now deprecated in favor of https://github.com/stackforge/ec2-api# starting in Liberty the v21 implementation replaces the v2 # implementation and is suggested that you use it as the default. If # this causes issues with your clients you can rollback to the # *frozen* v2 api by commenting out the above stanza and using the # following instead:: # /v1.1: openstack_compute_api_v2 # /v2: openstack_compute_api_v2 # if rolling back to v2 fixes your issue please file a critical bug # at - https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bugs # # v21 is an exactly feature match for v2, except it has more stringent # input validation on the wsgi surface (prevents fuzzing early on the # API). It also provides new features via API microversions which are # opt into for clients. Unaware clients will receive the same frozen # v2 API feature set, but with some relaxed validation /v1.1: openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible /v2: openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible # NOTE: this is deprecated in favor of openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible[composite:openstack_compute_api_v21_legacy_v2_compatible]noauth2 = compute_req_id faultwrap sizelimit noauth2 legacy_v2_compatible osapi_compute_app_v21 keystone = compute_req_id faultwrap sizelimit authtoken keystonecontext legacy_v2_compatible osapi_compute_app_v21
deleted_lines: /v1.1: openstack_compute_api_v2 /v2: openstack_compute_api_v2/v3: openstack_compute_api_v3 [composite:openstack_compute_api_v3]noauth = request_id faultwrap sizelimit noauth_v3 osapi_compute_app_v3 noauth2 = request_id faultwrap sizelimit noauth_v3 osapi_compute_app_v3 keystone = request_id faultwrap sizelimit authtoken keystonecontext osapi_compute_app_v3[filter:noauth_v3] paste.filter_factory = nova.api.openstack.auth:NoAuthMiddlewareV3.factory [app:osapi_compute_app_v3] paste.app_factory = nova.api.openstack.compute:APIRouterV3.factory

subject: Update Users Table to single HTML
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 20:18:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/9e66592525689dc197a2fb9ee21f7bab18be047e', 'message': 'Update Users Table to single HTML

The multiple table files actually made it more difficult to see
the whole picture of the table. You would have to have multiple files
open to correlate the column headers, column data, and details sections.

Future patches can add additional helper directives to simplify this
even further.

Also removed batch actions and row actions from table. We will
introduce them back as we add each action back in.

To test set DISABLED = False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py

Change-Id: Ia6cf77cadef48d1f6725e8f36717b042ce3beb00
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-27 20:18:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/47a598b4530ff7960486d70f62b8d6159f64ff7a', 'message': 'Update Users Table to single HTML

commit_message:
Update Users Table to single HTML

The multiple table files actually made it more difficult to see
the whole picture of the table. You would have to have multiple files
open to correlate the column headers, column data, and details sections.

Future patches can add additional helper directives to simplify this
even further.

Also removed batch actions and row actions from table. We will
introduce them back as we add each action back in.

To test set DISABLED = False in _3031_identity_users_panel.py

Co-Authored-By: Cindy Lu <clu@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ia6cf77cadef48d1f6725e8f36717b042ce3beb00
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

commit_message:
Support Network objects in set_network_host

This adds an RPC API version check so that we can send Network objects
through to the network manager's set_network_host method.

Part of blueprint liberty-objects

Change-Id: I6e0325a3e201f3671a9e97c52eecb7b2f1ce975b

Explictly set file mode on IPSec pre-shared key files

The file containing the pre-shared key for VPN connections should
not be world-readable.

Partial-Bug: 1488320

commit_message:
Adds command to fetch specified backend capabilities

This change adds a new admin-api to allow admin to fetch
specified backend capabilities which includes volume stats and
vendor unique properties.
With this command, admin can obtain what the current deployed
backend in Cinder is able to do from the endpoint.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint get-volume-type-extra-specs

Change-Id: I355a5b57994d1407a088c86530d7ef362ecd31ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-cinderclient refs/changes/47/215847/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('host', metavar='<host>', help='Cinder host to show backend volume stats and properties; ' 'takes the form: host@backend-name') @utils.service_type('volumev2') def do_get_capabilities(cs, args): """Show backend volume stats and properties. Admin only.""" capabilities = cs.capabilities.get(args.host) infos = dict() infos.update(capabilities._info) prop = infos.pop('properties', None) utils.print_dict(infos, "Volume stats") utils.print_dict(prop, "Backend properties")

commit_message:
zuul/layout: make non-voting puppet-keystone beaker on trusty

Ubuntu Liberty packaging (still considered as unstable) is currently
broken for keystone package.

Since keystone is the common project used by any other modules, we can't
get stuck until they fix the package.
The pacakge works for centos7 so we still have beaker jobs running on
RDO trunk, so in the meantime Ubuntu fix the package, let's set it as
non-voting so it will unblock our CI.

This patch is temporary and will probably be reverted as soon Ubuntu
provides stable enough packages for Keystone and other broken services.

Change-Id: I6821dab1f204b83cc0d0d548de8de602aeaf8a6b

commit_message:
Pull ceph.conf for cinder role

In a rare scenario of having cinder nodes (providing storage for Cinder LVM
backend) in an OpenStack environment configured to use Ceph RBD as backend for
Cinder volumes, cinder-volume on a cinder node would fail to connect to Ceph
because ceph.conf isn't there.

Change-Id: I1c4119fbfca3db5f234b18e1e03b7e31b971287e
Closes-Bug: 1319106

commit_message:
Adopt the migration chaining and branch names from neutron

Neutron recently renamed branches [1] and switched to down_revision to
link liberty initial scripts to kilo. Let's do the same for vpnaas.

[1]: Id524d7673ad248c831f6dbb3a6f2f3c50094acae
[2]: If551633ab26e0eac549c1e13cfa0771383a1a060

Change-Id: Iab29a785fca1ce86148f77f5973b9d7debce44a8
Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

commit_message:
Encap netaddr-0.7.16

netaddr-0.7.16 was released 2015-08-30. After that, the gate problem
seems to happen. This patch adds the cap to use the previous version
of netaddr for the workaround.

Change-Id: I57c0a4e88d311d7ccc3615395435461dd56227ff
Depends-On: I4d391f2352d71089db8666e3650121799a774a30
Related-Bug: #1490368

commit_message:
ovsdb server connection initiation implementation

ovsdb server initiates the connection to l2gw agent with the entries in
manager table in ovsdb hardware vtep schema.
A configurable option 'enable_manager' in .ini file is provided so that
the connection can be initiated by the ovsdb server or not based on boolean
value.
By default 'enable_manager' value is False, turn on the variable to True
to initiate the connection from ovsdb server to l2gw agent.

Closes-Bug:1466302

Change-Id: Ib668ecda381367ea9f2f3cfa45e63d0e91e48f33

added_lines: import socket self.enable_manager = cfg.CONF.ovsdb.enable_manager if self.enable_manager: self._connect_to_ovsdb_server() else: self.looping_task = loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall( self._connect_to_ovsdb_server) if ((self.gateways and self.enable_manager) or (self.gateways and self.l2gw_agent_type == n_const.MONITOR)): if not self.enable_manager: try: eventlet.greenthread.spawn_n( ovsdb_fd.set_monitor_response_handler) except Exception: raise SystemExit(Exception.message) if (self.l2gw_agent_type == n_const.MONITOR and not self.enable_manager): if not self.enable_manager: self._stop_looping_task() self._disconnect_all_ovsdb_servers()
deleted_lines: self.looping_task = loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall( self._connect_to_ovsdb_server) if self.gateways and self.l2gw_agent_type == n_const.MONITOR: try: eventlet.greenthread.spawn_n( ovsdb_fd.set_monitor_response_handler) except Exception: raise SystemExit(Exception.message) if self.l2gw_agent_type == n_const.MONITOR: self._stop_looping_task() self._disconnect_all_ovsdb_servers()

commit_message:
Replace "p" variable by "port_data"

the local variable p is meaningless, and
 can't be printed in pdb debug.

Change-Id: Id2325bc7658125926059fb6aca8def4a3213f8dc
